items.text: The Silk Road was a super-long trade route, stretching over 6,400 kilometers, connecting cultures and ideas.
The name 'Silk Road' was invented in the late 1800s, but some people think 'Silk Routes' is a better name.
Some historians argue that the term 'Silk Road' ignores the contributions of nomadic traders who were just as important.
